Drew Carson.Action: Struggling through a horse stance, showing effort but unable to maintain it fully, drops out onto his knees.
Hurries to help Master Kwan up after they fall, showing concern.
Apologizes sincerely to Master Kwan for accidentally scalding him with hot wax.
Smiles a defeated smile when Kwan slaps the tape into his hand
Responds politely and tries to minimize conflict with Bob by saying 'Look, Bob, I'm not bothering you, am I?'
Calls Bob 'not your son' and threatens him, escalating tension
Sarcastically tells Bob he won't let him be part of his entourage when he becomes the best fighter
Responds to Bob with 'Just leave me alone' and 'I NEVER asked for anything from you,' then leaves abruptly.
Wins fights in the tournament despite wearing an ill-fitting suit.
Maintains focus and composure while watching competitor Trevor win repeatedly.
Shows vulnerability and self-doubt by admitting 'I just can't do it ­ I'm not getting any better' to his master Kwan.
Quietly endures public humiliation and defeat without lashing out or blaming others.
Avoids confrontation, withdraws silently after losing, showing little outward expression or retaliation.
Smiles after learning Kwan is not Shaolin, showing openness rather than anger
Respectfully bows to Kwan, addressing him as Master
Refuses Kwan's offer to pay for his ticket, insisting he will make it himself
Stops to watch a group of older citizens going through Tai Zhi routines under the weeping willow trees.
Forces his way onto a crowded train through a window like everyone else despite the chaos and discomfort.
Sits peacefully next to an old man with red, rotted teeth who smiles at him, apparently accepting the stranger without hesitation.
Stops to ask for directions at a drink stand, but the woman does not understand him and takes the money anyway.
Wanders aimlessly until he finds a directional sign to Shaolin Temple and follows it.
Approaches a group of girls and asks for directions with politeness but fails to get a helpful response.
Expresses frustration and impatience openly when communication barriers prevent him from getting answers.
Apologizes for expecting others to speak English, admitting his mistake.
Interacts playfully with Ashema on the bicycle, responding to her holding his waist without discomfort and even seeking more bumps.
Acknowledges the Shaolin monks do not need luck, showing respect and confidence.
Distracted when responding to Ashema about monks not being allowed around girls, indicates lack of focus.
Moves confidently into the temple alone and explores without hesitation.
Wanders into a chanting hall unnoticed and quietly leaves without disrupting, demonstrating awareness and tact.
Firmly insists he is not a tourist and demands to be allowed to train as a monk despite clear rules and rejection.
Refuses to leave and attempts to stay by sitting down, showing persistence.
Fails to adjust or negotiate after being told no and physically removed from the temple.
Laughs off embarrassment when his backpack spills underwear and socks, then quietly gathers them up and moves on.
Greets Ashema sincerely and engages in conversation after a rough day.
Drinks multiple cups of tea, visibly slumps showing vulnerability about being kicked out of the temple.
Refuses to give up on becoming a monk despite setback, showing commitment and openness in sharing fears about disgrace.
Keeps his composure after his belongings are spilled and laughed at, re-gathers his clothing and continues to look for Ashema.
Admits he was kicked out of the temple and shows emotional vulnerability but does not give up on his goal of becoming a monk.
Drinks excessively at the tea stall following the setback, showing signs of emotional distress.
Listens thoughtfully to Ashema's grandfather's story and compliments him sincerely.
Decides to camp out in front of the temple despite harsh conditions, showing determination but no direct interaction with others in this moment.
Remains silent and does not respond when the Admissions Monk angrily tells him to leave.
Apologizes respectfully to San De after initially making fun of him, showing social awareness and humility.
Recognizes and admits his initial discomfort and pain but persists and finds a way to become ‘part of the courtyard’ and feel powerful, indicating resilience and mental adaptation.
Uses a story and a symbolic gesture (holding the spider) to communicate his dedication and transformation convincingly to San De.
Dismissively refers to San De as ‘just a grunt, a janitor sweeping up and all,’ which can indicate a lack of social tact or respect.
Looks at Ashema and her Bau Bau and smiles before entering the temple
Sits crushed and tries to understand his failure before gaining acceptance into the temple

Remains composed and wary despite initial disappointment and hostility; smiles at Ashema and her dog before proceeding; accepts the Drill Sergeant's call and joins the disciples despite feeling crushed.
Is crushed and despairing when he believes his chance is gone; struggles to understand the situation when initially excluded.
Answers ritual questions mostly correctly after being prompted, eventually gives sincere answers, sneaks a peek at San De and receives a wink in return.
Answers questions but initially fails to use the correct ritual phrasing, requiring prompting and correction by the Drill Sergeant.
Quickly corrects his answers after being prompted, showing ability to learn and comply under pressure.
Pauses and hesitates before answering a key question, looking to the Drill Sergeant for confirmation.
Recovers from incorrect answer by correcting himself promptly when the Drill Sergeant covers his eyes, indicating adaptability.
Sneaks a peak at San De and receives a slight smile and wink, suggesting some degree of confidence or rapport despite earlier hesitation.
Recognizes the true authority of the monk he previously underestimated, showing situational awareness.
Engages in a petty scuffle over his backpack, resisting temple protocol.
Reluctantly complies with the Drill Sergeant’s order and hands over his backpack, demonstrating some adaptability.
Mocks or complains when paired with Gao and the Drill Sergeant, showing negative attitude toward the situation.
Shoves Gao and tries to grab the robes back when Gao takes them from him.
Shows awareness and caution after being warned by Li about Gao.
Argues stubbornly with the D.S. about his haircut, resisting the required change.
Reluctantly accepts the haircut and the break from the outside world despite unhappiness.
Trips Gao secretly after Gao hits him with his shoulder
Thanks Li for switching beds with Gao
Engages in friendly conversation with Li about their hometowns
Responds rudely to Gao by telling him to 'Blow me!'
Cries out and reacts quickly when hit by a stick while sleeping, gets into a fighting stance belatedly
Looks around for attacker but finds no one, shows alertness
Gives up on further defense and climbs back into bed bone-weary
Reactively yelps and looks for attacker after being whacked at latrine, although no one is there
Makes a displeased face at the meager rice gruel but continues to eat when challenged
Engages positively with other disciples, shows enthusiasm about starting training
Asks questions about upcoming training, shows curiosity and engagement
Shows excitement initially about training, engaged with the group.
Questions and complains openly about digging latrines instead of training.
Lifts and carries heavy buckets of dirt with muscles straining, showing physical capability and endurance.
Teaches American songs to fellow disciples to boost morale during hard manual labor.
Gets hit by a pole on the back but quickly gets up, demonstrating resilience and toughness.
Baskets of dirt he carries are not full; the overseer dumps the dirt and reproaches him, indicating incomplete work.
Shakes his head and quickly eats meager food without complaint when asked if there is a problem.
Forces a smile when embarrassed by spilling water.
Muttering threatening remarks to himself ('I'm gonna get you, man').
Shows determination and effort by carrying heavy buckets and crossing difficult terrain.
Tries to stop spilled water but is too late.
Refuses to give way to Gao, engaging in a standoff.
Carries heavy buckets of water strained by the weight and overcomes difficult terrain to return to the temple.
Spills all the water when putting down the buckets, failing to maintain control.
Determined and defiant, tries to show no weakness despite exhaustion.
Engages in a stand-off with Gao on a narrow ridge, refusing to back down.
Stops working to watch the fighting monks, shows skepticism by saying 'This is ridiculous.'
Is struck by the drill sergeant with a bamboo pole but restrains himself from arguing and returns to work.
Comes up with an idea to get even with the drill sergeant and shares it with other disciples, showing initiative and collaboration.
After the drill sergeant breaks the trap easily, Drew and the disciples immediately run away when spotted, indicating prudence.
Sleeping during meditation when others are focused
Works hard alongside the group in the fields
Holds court and encourages standing up for rights, inspiring others to act
Confronts Gao, challenges him to take a stand, puts group cohesion over individual comfort
Falls asleep during meditation, fails to stay alert and disciplined.
Works hard in the fields alongside others, showing diligence and perseverance.
Leads a group discussion advocating for standing up for rights and taking initiative.
Challenges established authority thoughtfully and attempts to rally support.
Uses a clear ultimatum to pressure a reluctant member (Gao), demonstrating leadership confidence.
Approaches San De politely and requests permission to speak first.
Expresses gratitude to San De for the opportunity to train at Shaolin Temple.
Sputters nervously when given the chance to speak.
Attempts to take initiative by requesting permission to speak first to Master San De.
Fails to articulate clearly when given the chance to speak, sputtering and hesitating.
Shows respect for authority by ultimately accepting San De’s final decision without argument.
Leads the disciples in celebrating with a party, puts on music, and teaches dance routines, creating a joyful and inclusive atmosphere.
Blocks Gao's attempt to stop the music, leading to a physical confrontation.
Waves to the D.S. in a friendly manner when caught, showing a relaxed and approachable attitude.
Leads the disciples enthusiastically, organizes a party with music and dancing, and teaches others dance moves, showing social confidence and initiative.
Blocks Gao's attempt to stop the party, escalating to a physical confrontation, showing poor conflict management and impulsivity.
Notices the door opening and quickly acts to turn off the boom box and hide it with his body, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Asks for clarification about 'Think not thinking' showing curiosity and engagement with the training.
Appears confused by the monk’s explanation and the concept of 'Think not thinking.'
Struggles to keep up with group training; fails to perform the pole techniques and nearly injures himself.
Keeps attempting difficult exercises despite initial failure and physical difficulty, such as Iron Palm training and pole exercises.
Insists on using blocking techniques learned elsewhere rather than adopting the monk's method.
Bows and turns to continue working with Li after correction
Gets angry and hits the ground with his fist after failing in a maneuver
Smiles ruefully and bows to the instructor when called as partner
Expresses frustration openly by complaining that this isn't martial arts but gymnastics
Uses a block he was taught but it is ineffective against Gao's attack; gets slammed brutally.
Attempts a flying move but falls hard and responds with visible frustration.
Raises a concern about the safety of performing takedowns on hard concrete without mats.
Sits in the dirt watching others succeed, not actively improving or persevering at the moment.
Accepts challenge despite no mats and hard concrete floor, keeps getting up after brutal takedowns, shows respect and concern for instructor by checking understanding of last move.
Twists at the last moment to take impact on already bruised shoulder, showing physical skill and resilience.
Tries to get up despite pain and falls back down, showing persistence though limited by injury.
Dismisses medical help and insists he is all right despite serious bruise, showing confidence but possibly poor judgment about his own condition.
Responds humorously to Li about being hurt, indicating mental toughness and a degree of emotional control.
Does not retaliate or react significantly when doused with dirty water, showing composure or restraint.
Clears the training chamber by sweeping the floor, showing respect for the space.
Engages playfully and imaginatively with the broom, performing martial arts moves and entertaining himself.
Takes a physical hit without aggression or retaliation, adjusting his frisbee protector calmly.
Impulsively hugs Ashema, genuinely happy to see her.
Engages playfully and warmly with Ashema and her friends, compliments Ashema.
Kisses Ashema's hand gently after accepting party invitation.
Dismisses Li's warning about getting kicked out playfully and confidently.
Insists on going to party to have fun and relax despite rules.
Impulsively gives Ashema a hug despite temple rules and warnings from Li.
Confidently interacts with Ashema and the girls, charmingly accepting the party invitation and reassuring others.
Challenges authority (Li) regarding temple rules lightly, showing a casual disregard for consequences.
Balances seriousness with fun, advocating for deserved relaxation after hard work.
Introduces all his friends to the girls, making sure everyone is paired off, helping to create a friendly social atmosphere.
Responds to confrontation calmly at first, attempts to negotiate ('Can't we talk this over?'), showing restraint and a desire to avoid conflict.
Engages in slow dancing with Ashema, showing affectionate and sincere behavior.
After being pushed and attacked, does not retaliate immediately, appears hesitant to fight.
Refuses to leave when threatened by tough guys, potentially showing stubbornness or lack of tolerance to intimidation.
Introduces all his friends confidently and gets the party started by signaling Ashema to play music and initiate dancing.
Responds calmly and verbally to the threat posed by the tough guys, refusing to back down initially.
Gets physically overpowered and knocked to the ground early in the confrontation, showing lack of readiness to fight despite the hostile environment.
Attempts to de-escalate the violence by saying 'Can't we talk this over?' while physically restrained, indicating a non-aggressive but perhaps less effective approach under pressure.
Looks at others and shrugs when told only he must go with D.S., allowing them to stay behind.
Remains silent and stoic while being accused and confronted by headmistress, police officials, and San De.
Walks quickly away from the police and avoids confrontation initially.

No visible attempt to defend or explain himself against the morals charge in the scene.

Lies quietly in the dark, reflecting alone.
Avoids long goodbyes to others by leaving quickly.

Smiles and embraces Li and Gao along with the entire group showing solidarity.
Tries to appear humble when talking with San De.
Avoids responding to San De's criticism and looks down.
Asks for help and admits fear of failure.
Decides to stay at the temple despite difficulties to support his friends and keep them out of trouble.
Responds to sudden loud noise by quickly reacting and checking the source, showing alertness.
Expresses vulnerability about being repeatedly attacked at night but acknowledges the situation without panic.
Hesitantly acknowledges special training opportunity but walks with peers shaking his head, possibly indicating doubt or reluctance.
Openly shows his identity as a monk without attempting to hide it, indicating confidence and acceptance.
Stops Ashema from speaking by putting a finger on her lips and tenderly strokes her cheek, demonstrating emotional control and decisiveness.
Smiles slightly while cleaning plates and smiles bigger when he confirms no one is around after a surprise attack.
Engages in friendly martial exchange with Li, culminating in mutual respect shown by Li slapping Drew's hand after being hit.
Carries a young woman across a stream without hesitation.
Leaves Li and Gao confused with a playful remark after carrying the woman.
Catches a difficult throw in stride after a brief hesitation, effectively reading San De's signal and executing the play.
Carries a young woman across a stream without hesitation, showing decisiveness and physical capability.
Handles a potentially problematic situation (carrying the girl) with humor and confidence, defusing tension.
Stops a thug from slapping a young boy and fights off the attackers to protect the boy and father.
Bends down to pick up the stolen goods and returns them to the boy and his father.
Kneels down, looks deeply into the boy's eyes, touches the boy's cheek, smiles, and bows before leaving.
Does not get up after being kicked and dirtied by thugs, tolerating humiliation.
Refuses to engage in seduction despite temptation, politely but firmly enforces his vow of abstinence, gently takes the woman's hands and looks her in the eye.
Carefully examines the swamp obstacles and proceeds cautiously after nearly stepping on an alligator head.
Smiles and looks determined while crossing the dangerous rope bridge.
Engages verbally with the man behind him on the rope bridge, asking if it can hold both of them, despite the man's aggressive behavior.
Concentrates and moves forward slowly but surely through the dangerous waterfall.
Examines the swamp carefully and figures out he can jump between rocks and stumps to cross.
Almost falls several times while jumping but regains balance and gets into a rhythm.
Cautiously escapes from an alligator's head disguised as a rock by quick reflex and further examines landing spots carefully.
Smiles confidently before crossing the rope bridge, stashes map away, and keeps focused despite fear of the drop.
Handles an aggressive man pushing and kicking him on a fraying rope bridge, tries to maintain control and hurries across.
Fails to adequately avoid the danger of the fraying rope, resulting in a fall into the side of the mountain.
Apologizes sincerely to the Arhat and admits failure without excuses.
Bows repeatedly to show respect and humility.
Smiles ruefully at the absurdity of his situation, showing self-awareness.
Smiling as he realizes that it was all a test ­ every moment of it.
Engages in playful, enthusiastic destruction of the farm building with fellow disciples, having a great time together.
Calmly supports two full-sized disciples hanging off his arm, demonstrating strength and calm under pressure.
Realizes the entire prior situation was a test, showing awareness and insight.
Trains and moves through complicated martial arts routines with ease alongside other expert fighters.
Throws a shuriken that hits the target dead center.
Manipulates the spear skillfully like a master.
Engages in a pole fight using kicks and punches effectively against an opponent.
Participates enthusiastically in physically demanding tasks, such as tearing down a building using martial arts techniques with zeal and effectiveness.
Supports two full-sized disciples hanging off his arm calmly, demonstrating notable strength and composure.
Calmly avoids and blocks an unexpected staff attack and then counterattacks to reveal the attacker.
Calmly avoids and blocks multiple strikes, then successfully disarms opponent by pulling the staff.
Volunteers to take on the final and most difficult trial at the Shaolin Temple despite being told he need not.
Requests to be the first to enter the Wooden Man Chamber, demonstrating confidence and initiative.
Receives a light smack on the back of the head from the D.S., questions it but smiles and proceeds calmly.
Faces fear and pain but persists through difficult physical and mental challenges, reminding himself 'I am a Shaolin monk' and pushing forward despite bruises and setbacks.
Initially caught off guard by the wooden statues' attacks and driven back, showing fear and self-doubt.
Recalls training and motivational words, regains composure, and uses breathing techniques to steady himself.
Successfully blocks, avoids, rolls, jumps and redirects multiple attacks, demonstrating skill and mental preparedness.
Quickly adjusts to a surprise attack by jumping and spinning out of the way.
Blocks and misdirects incoming spears efficiently, showing quick reflexes and combat ability.
Successfully completes the chamber test and becomes a full-fledged fighting monk.
Acts confidently and respectfully by approaching San De alone to express gratitude and engage in a meaningful conversation.
Excuses himself politely from the group to follow his intuition and seek out San De, showing social and emotional intelligence.
Smiles thoughtfully upon San De's revelation, showing emotional processing and receptivity.
Immediately agrees to help at an international tournament without hesitation.
Dresses appropriately in a fighting monk's costume and bows respectfully to fellow monks.
Shows confidence by calmly asking if they are late and expressing willingness to assist in any way.

Is stunned and dumbstruck by Trevor's behavior but does not react aggressively or confrontationally
Passively watches Trevor's humiliating treatment of the Shaolin fighter without intervening
Is stunned and dumbstruck by Trevor's unexpected appearance and behavior, unable to respond verbally or defend himself in the moment.
Internally relives his past humiliation while watching Trevor dominate the Shaolin fighter, showing deep awareness of his own previous failures.
Refuses to fight Trevor despite the crowd's demand, stating he has nothing to prove and that the arts are not about competition.
Acknowledges his past humiliation by Trevor honestly and shows personal growth by focusing on defeating his ego rather than his opponent.
Refuses to fight for personal glory or ego, showing calm and composure.
Accepts responsibility to fight when necessary to teach a lesson for the temple's tradition.
Encourages camaraderie with fellow monks by high-fiving and saying 'For the temple...'
Sits alone in his corner without crew or pampering unlike opponent.
Calmly refuses to fight for personal glory or ego, demonstrating restraint and self-awareness.
Understands the implication of the master’s words and smiles slowly, indicating confident acceptance of responsibility.
Leads by example by high-fiving allies and entering the ring to face a provocation, showing leadership and readiness.
Instead of knocking out the opponent while he is defenseless, Drew smiles, lifts Trevor up, shakes his hand, and puts an arm around him to steady him in front of the crowd.
Is absent when thanked for the beautiful Shaolin uniform, indicating a possible lack of presence or engagement at a key moment.
Dismisses studying opponent tapes and relies on intuition alone initially.
Ultimately accepts the tape and advice from Kwan after initial resistance.
Displays confidence in winning despite advice to study more.
Engages in a tense verbal exchange with stepfather, asserting independence but escalating conflict.
Responds to criticism with sarcasm instead of constructive dialogue.
Tries to crawl out of the ring after losing decisively; appears defeated and publicly humiliated.
Sits pensive and sad with acupuncture needle in arm, showing emotional struggle and frustration about not improving.
Voices self-doubt and states 'I just can't do it - I'm not getting any better!'
Contemplates future while walking silently, showing some reflective and thoughtful attitude despite setback.
Meets Kwan's gaze attentively, showing respect and engagement.
Listens quietly as Kwan reveals his deception and disappointments.
Does not interrupt or dismiss Kwan despite learning the mentor’s dishonesty.
Listens attentively and meets Kwan's gaze, showing engagement and respect.
Questions Kwan about the truth of his stories, showing curiosity and critical thinking.
Takes in Kwan's confession that he never trained at Shaolin and that previous inspiration was based on fabricated stories.
Is told by Kwan that despite potential, Drew cannot be taken further by him, implying a limitation Drew currently faces.
Decides confidently to train at the Shaolin Temple to improve himself after a loss.
Insists on making it to the Shaolin Temple himself despite Kwan offering to pay for his ticket.
Politely asks a woman at a drink stand for directions and tries to order a drink.

Expresses frustration and tiredness when not receiving help and wonders why no one speaks English.
Admits he has been flustered and apologizes for expecting others to speak English, acknowledging his mistake.
Expresses pride and clear intention to join the temple as a monk, showing confidence in his goals.
Successfully rides a bicycle strongly and confidently despite initial instability, taking on the challenge actively.
Does not address the mockery and laughter from the locals regarding his appearance and ambition, passively allowing it without confrontation or defense.
Thanks Ashema for the ride and hopes to see her again.

Jokes insultingly calling a monk 'baldy' and mocking him to get noticed.
Claps appreciatively after monks finish chanting, showing encouragement.

Refuses to leave and sits down, demonstrating determination and sincerity in his desire.

Listens attentively to the story, reflects on its meaning, and responds respectfully and thoughtfully.
Decides to camp out in front of the temple as a demonstration of commitment and determination.

Perseveres in difficult weather, unbothered by wind and rain.
Befriends local children who initially torment him; becomes part of their group.
Shows quiet companionship toward a spider sitting on his hand.
Maintains determination and focus alone in temple courtyard despite isolation.
Drew's perseverance impresses the old monks, and he shows firm determination and a solid form despite wind and rain.

Drew is part of the group now and accepted by the children, showing social adaptability and emotional competence in a challenging environment.

Jokes self-deprecatingly with others after his head is shaved, reflecting humor and camaraderie.

Uses rude language openly in a disciplined environment, risking trouble.

Shows some fear that the D.S. might return after his outburst but does not escalate the situation further.
Teaches American work songs to other disciples while working, engaging them in a friendly way.

Engages in confrontation with Gao, standing his ground despite being physically assaulted.
Suffers pain silently, with a bloody hand caused by a splinter, but receives no compassionate help from others.
Sits trying to meditate and think of nothing but is unable to succeed.
Immediately reacts by turning to one direction after getting hit, but then is hit again from the other direction, showing difficulty in identifying the attacker.
Calls out for the attacker confidently after being hit from behind.

Asks an intelligent question about 'night soil' to learn about its nature.
Stops working to watch the passing monks, expresses frustration by saying 'This is ridiculous.'
Does not confront the Drill Sergeant after being hit with a bamboo pole, instead returns to work silently.

Runs away with the group immediately after their prank is discovered to avoid trouble.
Attempts to learn new Shaolin techniques despite difficulty and falling repeatedly.
Works with his friend Li, practicing techniques together.
Insists on using a blocking technique he was originally taught instead of adopting the Shaolin monk's advice.
Acknowledges Li's concern about his injury and says he is all right despite pain.
Accepts help from Li to get up and go to the showers.
Smiles and waves at others before being knocked off by the waterfall, shows effort to join and support fellow disciples.
Smiles sheepishly after wiping out, acknowledging the group's shared struggle with good-natured humor.
Shakes head and gets back up after being knocked down in training without complaining.
Rushing to catch the statue with Li to prevent it from falling.
Smiles and bows respectfully to the D.S. and says goodbye to Li.
Flips the frisbee in playful ways and enjoys light-hearted moments with Li.
At first tries to hit Gao with full force, not fully embracing the non-harmful intent of the drill, and responds defensively to the monk's advice.
Tries to strike Gao with force but is thrown off balance and falls to the floor.
Acknowledges that the goal of the drill is not to hurt, but initially fails to adjust his method accordingly.
Plays frisbee skillfully with Li, showing acrobatic catching ability.
Almost causes an ancient statue to fall but quickly and effectively prevents it from tipping over.
Quickly hides the frisbee and resumes work with brooms to avoid getting in trouble with the D.S.
Shows respect and understanding by bowing and smiling when instructed by the D.S.
Takes a moment to stand in the training chamber, soaking up its tradition and atmosphere.

Does not meet San De's eyes when confronted; hesitant and resistant to teachings.

Has difficulty performing the soft style Shaolin Wu Shu during training.

Bows respectfully to the Bau Bau and interacts amicably with others, demonstrating social awareness and respect.
Complies with group expectations despite social teasing, showing some adaptability though with hesitation.
Calms the group by saying 'Chill out, guys! It's our day off!'
Plays frisbee with the group while enjoying their freedom

Encourages the guys forward by calling attention to girls in a friendly manner

Calmly tells the group to chill out and take their day off, showing relaxed confidence in social leadership.

Challenges strict temple rules about women by approaching Ashema despite warnings, showing willingness to take risks but also potential disregard for important constraints.
Encourages others to relax and try dancing despite their awkwardness, takes initiative to teach slow dancing by demonstrating and using a boom box.

Responds to Gao's cheat attack by engaging back, continuing conflict without escalation or malice.

Responds quickly and decisively after being hit with full power in the face, engaging fully in the fight with Gao.

Admits fault first and takes responsibility for starting the fight.

Teases Gao jokingly about kicking his ass.

Leads the group outside, showing initiative and leadership.
Encourages Gao to join them, displaying confidence and social awareness.
Carefully scans the area before signaling others to jump down, showing situational awareness and tactical decision-making.
Responds quickly to an unexpected and tense situation with the drunken monk by seeking cover and maintaining composure.
Leads the group with a rallying call to face their fear and follow him into the school, showing leadership and encouragement.

Notices Wu's discomfort and proactively suggests regrouping to prepare stories, showing concern and leadership for the wellbeing of others.
Leads the group to escape quickly and efficiently when the headmistress arrives, demonstrating awareness and decisiveness.
Comforts and tries to calm the group after their rule-breaking, showing social perceptiveness and confidence.
Suggests reviewing their stories in case of interrogation, showing strategic thinking and preparedness.
Whispers 'Chill out, honey!' in response to the Headmistress's outburst
Expresses sincere apology and appreciation to his masters after the meeting
Whispers 'Chill out, honey!' in a tense meeting, showing a lack of serious judgment or respect for the gravity of the situation.
Expresses remorse and appreciation to his master after the meeting, showing awareness and willingness to take responsibility.
Expresses sorrow and apologizes to his master, showing emotional awareness and respect.
Hears that he is the only one being forced to leave but accepts it with resignation without protest.
Tells the other disciples what is happening despite the shock it causes them, showing a degree of openness and communication.
Lies down and sighs, seemingly overwhelmed or resigned rather than proactive.
Contemplates alone late at night, showing reflection and possibly inner processing.
Wakes early, packs efficiently, and leaves without unnecessary delay or dramatics.
Acknowledges he hates long goodbyes and exits with quiet dignity.
Pauses at the temple door to take in the moment, showing emotional depth but also acceptance.
Chuckles at himself after being drenched with water and hit in the stomach during training attack
Turns around and high-fives Gao after successfully blocking a powerful kick
Breaks into a little dance step, having fun at the end of a routine, causing the group to laugh
Nods at Gao and trains together under the waterfall in horse stance, showing mutual respect.
Carries dirty plates from dinner to garbage area and begins scraping them off.
Calmly avoids staff swung at him instead of reacting aggressively.
Attempts a kip multiple times, initially failing but then lands on his feet easily and is surprised by his own success.
Calmly and skillfully avoids staff attacks by not panicking and standing ground, letting the staff swing past him.
Snaps Gao with towel playfully while walking by.
Calls Gao a slur during fight: 'slant eye!'
Fights Gao intensely but bows and embraces him afterward, smiling.
Returns the bow to San De after receiving the quest and instructions.
Bends down to pick up the knocked drink glass, showing non-aggressive intent.
Tries to calmly address the aggressors ('OK, boys, just let me get my glass...') rather than escalate the situation.
Does not fight back aggressively but tries to avoid getting hit.
Accepts the mission to deliver the sacred scroll with respect and seriousness, bows to San De, and sets out promptly on the quest.
Handles an unexpected attack from thugs by quickly rolling to a standing position and attempting to avoid getting hit, showing situational awareness and physical skill.
Does not escalate the conflict despite being provoked and physically attacked, showing restraint and calmness.
Does not understand the language of his attackers and initially tries to negotiate verbally, which may be ineffective in this situation.
Chooses to save the man instead of the scroll, letting the scroll fall to save a life.
Carries the man to safety and shares a meal with him.
Feels worried about disappointing the arhat after his choice.
Considers dismissing the importance of the scroll by thinking 'Maybe he won't miss one little scroll...'
Bows respectfully to the Arhat and thanks him sincerely.
Laughs warmly at the Arhat’s unexpected advice about taking the bus.
Smiles and shakes his head in good-natured disbelief before bowing.
Questions his training and shows understanding that obedience evolves into self-guidance.
Recognizes and accepts practical advice (bus to return to temple) rather than stubbornly insisting on the difficult path.
Laughs at practical advice which initially seems absurd, but ultimately follows it.
Rises to the challenge despite being told he need not enter the chamber, insists on taking the test to fully belong.
Smiles at D.S.'s attempt to lighten him up after being playfully smacked.
Relaxes his face and body to endure the trap calmly, showing control and resolve.
Hits the whirling statue with a hook kick after stopping it, asserting himself confidently.
Embraces and congratulates other disciples as they complete the challenge.
Embraces and congratulates fellow disciples who made it through the chamber.
Excuses himself from group to approach San De respectfully and sincerely thanks him.
Shows humility by admitting he wouldn't have made it without San De's support.
Agrees immediately and warmly to help at the international tournament in Beijing with a smile, without pause.
Comforts Ashema by gently tilting her chin up, reading her emotion, and kissing away her fear.
Walks with Ashema holding hands, showing a close and respectful bond.
Bows respectfully to fellow monks, showing respect and sincerity.
Offers to help in any way he can regarding the fight, showing good nature and willingness to support.
Climbs the ropes and goes into the ring despite not knowing what to do at first.
Responds thoughtfully to provocation by refusing to fight, demonstrating emotional intelligence and self-control.
Walks out of the ring instead of engaging in a physical fight when challenged.
Shows a mature understanding that martial arts are not about proving superiority but about something deeper.
Rushes up to San De and gives him a hug after receiving the Golden Sash.
Bows respectfully to San De before and after accepting the Golden Sash.
Allows Ashema to take his arm and walks with him along the Great Wall.
Wins the Golden Sash and is celebrated by the monks in the ring.
Performs the beginning of a Shaolin form with confidence.

Gao.Action: Pours dirty water on Drew from above the window, drenching him.
